qas.question: What aspect of the Chassepot was superior to the German needle gun?
What French weapon was considered a rough prototype of the first machine gun?
How many barrels did the mitrailleuse feature?
What was the range of the mitrailleuse?
Treating the mitrailleuse like what rendered it far less effective

context: The French breech-loading rifle, the Chassepot, had a far <a0_0>longer range<a0_0/> than the German needle gun; 1,500 yards (1,400 m) compared to 600 yd (550 m). The French also had an early machine-gun type weapon, <a1_0>the mitrailleuse<a1_0/>, which could fire its <a2_0>thirty-seven barrels<a2_0/> at a range of around <a3_0>1,200 yd (1,100 m)<a3_0/>. It was developed in such secrecy, that little training with the weapon had occurred, leaving French gunners with no experience; the gun was treated like <a4_0>artillery<a4_0/> and in this role it was ineffective. Worse still, once the small number of soldiers who had been trained how to use the new weapon became casualties, there were no replacements who knew how to operate the mitrailleuse.
